oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Barry Moser interview, 2023 January 18
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Moser, Barry
Ruiz, Emily
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Oral history interview documenting the life of artist, author, and book designer, Barry Moser, in which Moser describes his education, identity as a Southerner, racism of the American South, printing process, publishing industry, and various projects including The Transmogrification of Narcissus, Frankenstein, or, The Modern Prometheus, and the Pennyroyal Caxton edition of The Holy Bible: Containing all the Books of the Old and New Testaments.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Art and literature; Artists' books -- Exhibitions; Bible -- Publication and distribution; Etching; Printing; Publishers and publishing; Racism; Self-portraits; Wood-engraving
Moser, Barry
